newsitem.title: USA: US OPTIONS FOCUS/Pre-holiday mood cuts index trade.
newsitem.headline: US OPTIONS FOCUS/Pre-holiday mood cuts index trade.

text.p: Trading in major U.S. stock index options, hampered earlier this week by Tuesday's Federal Reserve meeting, was slowed again on Friday by skeleton staffs and a pre-holiday mood, traders said.
U.S. financial markets will be closed Monday for Memorial Day.
"There's not a thing going on," one dealer in S&P 100 index .OEX and S&P 500 .SPX options said.
The solid rally in stocks failed to ignite much action in the options, he noted.
By 1130 CDT/1630 GMT, the OEX was up 5.19 at 825.85 and the SPX was up 5.16 at 840.82. June S&P 500 futures were up 3.05 at 843.30.
The bellwether Dow industrial average .DJI was up 40 at nearly 7,299.
In the OEX, the busiest options were the June 800 put, which traded about 2,100 contracts, and the June 880 call, which traded around 1,350.
The most active SPX option was the June 750 put, with volume of 4,500 contracts. The option, which had open interest of 24,728 contracts, was down 3/8 at 9/16.
Overall, by 1130 CDT/1630 GMT, SPX put volume was 11,072 compared to 4,517 in calls. In the OEX, put volume outpaced call volume by 10,015 to 7,985.
The head of one options trading desk in Chicago said he expected volume to drop off even more after U.S. Treasury bonds close at 1300 CDT/1800 GMT. T-bond futures close at 1210 CDT/1710 GMT.
"There's not a whole lot of volume, and I have a hunch that after bonds close there will be nothing," he said.
Volatilities eased slightly as the market moved higher and ahead of the long holiday weekend, traders said.
The Chicago Board Options Exchange's volatility index .VIX was down 0.37, or 1.75 percent, at 20.63. The VIX is priced off certain OEX options.
The VIX was at its lowest level since early May and had risen through the 24 level on Monday and Tuesday ahead of the Federal Reserve's Open Market Committee meeting.
Once the FOMC left interest rates unchanged Tuesday, volatilities crumbled as the market bounced higher.
